entry.title: Regulating Hartshorne's connectedness theorem
entry.summary: A classical theorem by Hartshorne states that the dual graph of any arithmetically Cohen-Macaulay projective scheme is connected. We provide a strong converse: Every connected graph is the dual graph of a suitable arithmetically Cohen-Macaulay projective curve of Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity at most 3, whose components are all rational normal curves. The regularity bound is smallest possible in general. Our second main result is a quantitative version of Hartshorne's result, in terms of Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity. If X is an arithmetically Gorenstein projective scheme of regularity r+1, and if every irreducible component of X has regularity at most r', we show that the dual graph of X is [(r+r'-1)/r']-connected. The bound is sharp.
